scenario_text.value: Did you find anything, Shuuji?
No, not yet.
Oh... I... I’m sorry, Shuuji.

It’s not your fault, Lopmon.
You’re doing your best.

You’re finding traces I would never see, and
you can get into a lot of tight places, too.

You’re doing a great job.
Let’s think what else we can try next.
Together we got this, Shuuji!

(Shuuji has changed.
He even praises Lopmon now.)
(They’re a teacher and his student now.)

(I think I’ve seen enough to let them keep at
it.)
(What should I say to Shuuji?)
Those are good vibes.
You’re like a teacher.
I’ll leave it to you.
Those are good vibes.
Those are some good vibes between you two.
You think so? Then I’m glad.

I don’t want to be a blowhard.
I’m just trying to do what I can to help.

I want to be a leader who pitches in and does
the work. Not just someone who gives orders.
Sounds good. Let me know if I can help.
You can definitely depend on me.
You’re like a teacher.

Shuuji, it’s like you’ve become a teacher!
And Lopmon is your student.
Me? A teacher?

I like that. I hadn’t thought of it that way,
but I can see it now that you mention it.

That might be a good job to go for, if we can
make it safely back home.
I’ll leave it to you.

It looks like you have things under control,
so I’ll leave it to you.
Great.

We’ll take a look around here, so Takuma, you
can go search <color=#B41919>somewhere else</color>.
You got it!
Takuma?
Yeah?

I need to break free from my obsession with
my dad. I don’t need to follow after him.
I wanted you to know that.
I hear you. I hope it all goes well.
Thanks, Takuma.

We’ll take a look around here, so you can go
search <color=#B41919>elsewhere</color>.
